content:
Hmm, ok i loop thru all possible values of a and b (assuming a limit of the length of the alphabet).  I get solutions for every testcase.  but multiple solutions for testcase 2:
KNHYCPHYPIYPZYKNHYAOHZ
NZBPIGBPGFPGTPNZBPACBT
EBHIVRHIRPIRQIEBHIFJHQ
IXUPEYUPYHPYCPIXUPDKUC
FL_GQP_GPBGPIGFL_GMN_I
OUIGHPIGPTGPRGOUIGMEIR
SMYIQ_YI_EI_PISMYICTYP
KWZDOVZDVLDVQDKWZDPIZQ
JDPIZ_PI_NI_GIJDPICBPG
THE_PIE_IS_IN_THE_OVEN
LOIZDQIZQJZQ_ZLOIZBPI_
...so how do I decide which is best?  They all contain "PI".  I can narrow it down with _ , but still not the first or last found is correct.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: With the addition of multiplication (getting closer to an affine cipher than a caesar cipher), the puzzle is more than different enough from Caesar is Chief, yet still appropriate for easy.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice idea for an easy puzzle

Some typos: Whereas, is to be expressed.
Puzzle is now OK for me.
The cipher has now been changed and is no longer Caesar cipher (X+A)%L.  Instead it is now ((X+A)*B)%L, making it harder

Although it is a slightly more difficult version, it looks very similar to this puzzle: https://www.codingame.com/ide/puzzle/caesar-is-the-chief. So, I wonder if it can be approved according to the contribution rules.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: More fun than applying the cypher directly.

I rated it as "Difficulty: Easy" because it can be solved with a loop and some if/else.  That feels like an easy to me.  Harder than "The Descent", easier than any "Difficulty: Medium" puzzle I've seen.

My rules of thumb for difficulty is as follows : 
* if/else and possible a loop is 'easy'.  
* Recursion, DFS, BFS, Minimax is 'medium'.  
* Tricky or mathy stuff with multiple steps is 'hard' or 'very hard'

Some context:
Long ago I created this but got some feedback that it "was too easy" as a puzzle and should be a clash of code.  In clash of code it has gotten feedback that it is too hard.  So I am presented it here again as a classic puzzle.  Here is a link to the clash https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/615955355e81da150427fbc22030665ef811
I've changed the puzzle to be a little more complicated since you approved.  Please take another look.  The cypher is now (C+A)*B instead of just C+A
Thanks for the link and good to know.  I'll give some thought to further improvements.  If you have any ideas of a change that would be significant enough please share
oops, somehow I truncated the E in PIE
Just to be clean, you are saying that it works with just 1 solution correct?
yes, it worked with one solution when I didn't use just PI
To be honest, I think your puzzle is a better (I mean more generic) version of the linked puzzle

If instead of a shift cypher in the form of (C+A)%L where the task is to discover A given the ordinal of the character C and the length L of the alphabet,

How about solving the cypher form ((C+A)*B)%L ?
All the current test cases can stay (i.e. B=1) and additional test cases can be added.  I'm not familiar with a way of reversing ((C+A)*B)%L, so imo this would make the problem a little more challenging because of the need to either know that kind of math (which would fit into esoteric) or an additional mapping step.  Either would increase the difficulty.
I've updated puzzle, the code, and added 2 new test cases that take into account the new cypher.
